1{-# LANGUAGE OverloadedStrings #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | I/O point: file, standard input, direct text, etc.
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Base.IO.IOPoint
7  ( -- * Named handle
8    NamedHandle (..),
9
10    -- * I/O point
11    IOPoint (..),
12    ioPointType, ioPointText,
13    ioPointFrom, ioPointList,
14
15    -- * Numbered I/O point
16    NIOPoint (..),
17    nioFrom,
18  ) where
19
20import qualified System.IO                     as IO
21import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.List     as B
22import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Prelude  as B
23
24
25-- ----------------------  Named handle
26
27-- | Named I/O handle.
28data NamedHandle = NamedHandle
29    { handleName :: String       -- ^ Name of handle
30    , handle     :: IO.Handle    -- ^ I/O handle
31    }
32
33instance Show NamedHandle where
34    show = handleName
35
36instance Eq NamedHandle where
37    h1 == h2 = handleName h1 == handleName h2
38
39instance Ord NamedHandle where
40    h1 `compare` h2 = handleName h1 `compare` handleName h2
41
42
43-- ----------------------  IOPoint
44
45data IOPoint
46    = IOPointFile   FilePath FilePath       -- ^ Context directory and target path
47    | IOPointUri    String                  -- ^ Universal resource identifier
48    | IOPointText   (Maybe String) B.Bz     -- ^ Code itself
49    | IOPointCustom String B.Bz             -- ^ Custom I/O
50    | IOPointStdin                          -- ^ Sandard input
51    | IOPointStdout                         -- ^ Sandard output
52    | IOPointOutput NamedHandle             -- ^ Output handler
53      deriving (Show, Eq, Ord)
54
55-- | Name of I/O point, i.e., @\"file\"@, @\"url\"@, @\"text\"@,
56--   @\"stdin\"@, or @\"stdout\"@.
57ioPointType :: IOPoint -> String
58ioPointType (IOPointFile _ _)   = "file"
59ioPointType (IOPointUri  _)     = "url"
60ioPointType (IOPointText _ _)   = "text"
61ioPointType (IOPointCustom _ _) = "custom"
62ioPointType (IOPointStdin)      = "stdin"
63ioPointType (IOPointStdout)     = "stdout"
64ioPointType (IOPointOutput _)   = "output"
65
66-- | Name of I/O point.
67ioPointText :: IOPoint -> String
68ioPointText (IOPointFile dir file)       = dir ++ file
69ioPointText (IOPointUri  url)            = url
70ioPointText (IOPointText (Just name) _)  = name
71ioPointText (IOPointText (Nothing) _)    = "<text>"
72ioPointText (IOPointCustom name _)       = name
73ioPointText (IOPointStdin)               = "<stdin>"
74ioPointText (IOPointStdout)              = "<stdout>"
75ioPointText (IOPointOutput h)            = handleName h
76
77-- | Create I/O point.
78ioPointFrom :: FilePath -> FilePath -> IOPoint
79ioPointFrom context path
80    | B.isPrefixOf "http://"  path  = IOPointUri  path
81    | B.isPrefixOf "https://" path  = IOPointUri  path
82    | B.isPrefixOf "ftp://"   path  = IOPointUri  path
83    | otherwise                     = IOPointFile context path
84
85-- | Create I/O points from using stdin, texts itself, filenames, and urls.
86ioPointList :: Bool -> [B.Bz] -> FilePath -> [FilePath] -> [IOPoint]
87ioPointList stdin texts context paths =
88    B.consIf stdin IOPointStdin $
89         IOPointText Nothing `map` texts ++
90         ioPointFrom context `map` paths
91
92
93-- ----------------------  NIOPoint
94
95-- | Numbered I/O point.
96data NIOPoint = NIOPoint
97    { nioNumber  :: Int        -- ^ Sequential number
98                               --   (0 for unnumbered, > 0 for numbered)
99    , nioPoint   :: IOPoint    -- ^ I/O point
100    } deriving (Show)
101
102instance Eq NIOPoint where
103    x == y
104      | xn == 0 && yn == 0  = nioPoint x == nioPoint y
105      | otherwise           = xn == yn
106      where xn = nioNumber x
107            yn = nioNumber y
108
109instance Ord NIOPoint where
110    x `compare` y
111      | xn == 0 && yn == 0  = nioPoint x `compare` nioPoint y
112      | otherwise           = xn `compare` yn
113      where xn = nioNumber x
114            yn = nioNumber y
115
116-- | Zero-numbered empty input point.
117instance B.Default NIOPoint where
118    def = nioFrom ""
119
120-- | Create input point for given lazy bytestring.
121nioFrom :: B.Bz -> NIOPoint
122nioFrom = NIOPoint 0 . IOPointText Nothing
123
